page.title: 19CHURCH/CHAPEL
page.content: The Church of the Holy Cross in Babcary was probably built under the influence of King Ina of Wessex, who built the nearby Monastery at Glastonbury. The church that still stands today was built in the 14th/15th centuries and the church was restored in 1875. The inside of the church is full of flowers, and it is very gay and colourful, and the altar is very impressive. The church is built of a single type of stone, and the church-yard is well kept, but many of the older memorials before 1800 are illegible. There is also a hall which is used as a chapel at Hazlegrove, and services are held every Sunday during the term time.
